item.title: IHG Pet Policy Guide: Why Kimpton Is the Best Chain for Large Dogs
item.description:
If you’ve been following along, you know I’m obsessed with Hilton for dog travel. But here’s the thing: IHG has a secret weapon that even Hilton can’t match.

It’s called Kimpton.

Kimpton is hands-down the most dog-friendly hotel brand in existence. No weight limits. No breed restrictions. No pet fees. Ever. They’ll welcome your Great Dane the same way they’d welcome a Chihuahua.

But Kimpton is just one piece of the IHG puzzle. Let me break down the entire IHG portfolio so you know exactly where you can (and can’t) bring your dog.

The IHG Pet-Friendly Lineup

IHG has 20 hotel brands, but not all of them welcome dogs. Here’s what you need to know:

Tier 1: The Gold Standard

Kimpton Hotels ‚≠ê THE BEST

  • Weight limit: None (“If your pet fits through the door, we’ll welcome them in”)
  • Pet fee: $0
  • Breed restrictions: None
  • Number of pets: Unlimited
  • Pet types: Dogs, cats, birds, fish, even your pet lizard

Kimpton isn’t just pet-friendly ‚Äî they’re pet-obsessed. Every property has a “Director of Pet Relations” (usually an adorable resident dog). They’ll greet your pet by name, provide beds and bowls, and even give you a list of nearby dog parks and pet-friendly restaurants.

The nightly wine hour? Your dog is invited.

Tier 2: Always Pet-Friendly (With Fees)

These brands welcome pets at ALL locations:

Staybridge Suites

  • Weight limit: 50 lbs (varies by property)
  • Pet fee: ~$75/week
  • Best for: Extended stays with a kitchen

Candlewood Suites

  • Weight limit: 80 lbs
  • Pet fee: $75 for 1-6 nights, $150 for 7+ nights
  • Best for: Budget-friendly extended stays

Both are extended-stay brands with full kitchens ‚Äî perfect for longer trips when you want to cook for yourself (and your pup).

Tier 3: Often Pet-Friendly (Check First)

These brands have pet-friendly properties, but policies vary by location:

Hotel Indigo

  • Weight limit: 40-80 lbs (varies)
  • Pet fee: $50-$75 per stay
  • Vibe: Boutique, artsy, neighborhood-focused

InterContinental

  • Weight limit: Varies widely
  • Pet fee: Can be steep ($100-$250 in major cities)
  • Best for: Luxury stays when you can find a good deal

Crowne Plaza

  • Weight limit: Varies by property
  • Pet fee: Varies
  • Note: Not all locations are pet-friendly

Holiday Inn / Holiday Inn Express

  • Weight limit: Usually 40-50 lbs
  • Pet fee: $25-$75 per stay
  • Note: Very hit-or-miss ‚Äî always call ahead

EVEN Hotels

  • Weight limit: Varies
  • Pet fee: Varies
  • Vibe: Wellness-focused, often in suburban areas

Tier 4: Usually NOT Pet-Friendly

  • Six Senses
  • Regent
  • Vignette Collection
  • HUALUXE

Why Kimpton Wins for Large Dogs

Let me be real: if you have a dog over 50 lbs, Kimpton is your only guaranteed option in the IHG family.

Here’s why this matters:

Brand 70-lb Dog Allowed?
Kimpton ‚úÖ Yes, always
Candlewood Suites ‚úÖ Yes (under 80 lbs)
Staybridge Suites ‚ùå No (50 lb limit)
Hotel Indigo ‚ö†Ô∏è Maybe (check property)
Holiday Inn ‚ùå Usually no

Ansel weighs 70 lbs. At Kimpton, nobody blinks. At most other IHG brands, we’d be turned away.

How to Earn IHG Points for Free Stays

Here’s where it gets good. You can stay at Kimpton for free using IHG One Rewards points.

The IHG Credit Cards

IHG One Rewards Premier Credit Card ($99/year)

  • 140,000 bonus points after $3,000 spend
  • Free night certificate every year (up to 40,000 points value)
  • 4th night free on award stays
  • Automatic Platinum Elite status

IHG One Rewards Traveler Credit Card ($0/year)

  • 80,000 bonus points after $2,000 spend
  • No annual fee
  • Silver Elite status

Point Values

IHG points are worth about 0.5-0.6 cents each. A typical Kimpton redemption runs 30,000-60,000 points per night, though prices vary by date and location.

Pro tip: The 4th night free perk on the Premier card is huge. Book 4 nights and you essentially get 25% off your points redemption.

Transfer Partners

You can also transfer points to IHG from:

  • Chase Ultimate Rewards (1:1)
  • Bilt Rewards (1:1)

But honestly? IHG points aren’t the best use of Chase points. I’d rather transfer to Hyatt. The IHG credit card bonuses are usually the better path.

Kimpton vs. Hilton: Which Is Better for Dogs?

I get this question a lot. Here’s my honest take:

Factor Kimpton Hilton
Pet fees $0 $0-$75 (varies)
Weight limits None None (most brands)
Number of properties ~70 7,000+
Loyalty program IHG One Rewards Hilton Honors
Point value ~0.5¬¢ ~0.5¬¢
Best for Boutique experience, guaranteed pet-friendly More locations, easier to find availability

My verdict: Kimpton is technically more dog-friendly, but Hilton’s massive footprint makes it more practical for everyday travel. I use both.

If there’s a Kimpton where I’m going? I book it. If not? Hilton it is.

Tips for Booking Pet-Friendly IHG Stays

  1. Always call the property directly ‚Äî Even “dog-friendly” hotels can have restrictions that aren’t listed online.

  2. Book Kimpton for guaranteed acceptance ‚Äî Don’t risk showing up with your 70-lb dog only to be told there’s a 50-lb limit.

  3. Use the IHG app filter ‚Äî Search for “Pet Friendly” under amenities, but verify the specific policy.

  4. Stack promotions ‚Äî IHG frequently runs double/triple point promotions. Combine with credit card bonuses for maximum value.

  5. Consider extended-stay brands ‚Äî Candlewood and Staybridge have kitchens, which is clutch for longer trips with dogs (no restaurant hunting!).

The Bottom Line

If you’re traveling with a large dog and want zero stress about pet policies, Kimpton is unbeatable. No weight limits, no fees, no judgment.

The trade-off? There are only about 70 Kimpton properties, mostly in major cities. You won’t find one in every small town.

For broader coverage, pair your IHG strategy with Hilton. Between the two programs, you’ll have pet-friendly options almost anywhere.

My recommendation:

  • Get the IHG Premier card for Kimpton stays ($99/year, free night certificate pays for itself)
  • Get the Hilton Surpass or Aspire for everywhere else
  • Never pay pet fees again

Have you stayed at a Kimpton with your dog? I’d love to hear about your experience ‚Äî leave a pawprint and tell me which property!

item.title: How to Book Kimpton Hotels Free with Points
item.description:
If you’ve traveled with a large dog, you know the drill: call ahead, confirm the weight limit, hope they don’t give you a hard time at check-in. It gets old.

Kimpton doesn’t play that game. Their policy is simple: if your pet fits through the door, they’re welcome. No weight limit. No breed restrictions. No pet fee. Ever.

It’s the most genuinely pet-friendly hotel chain I’ve found ‚Äî and you can book stays completely free using credit card points.

Jump to:

  • Why Kimpton for Dog Travelers
  • How to Earn IHG Points
  • IHG Credit Cards
  • Chase Transfer Partners

  • Best Kimptons for Dogs

Why Kimpton for Dog Travelers

Kimpton became the first major hotel chain to go pet-friendly back in 1992. They weren’t just tolerating pets ‚Äî they built it into the brand. Here’s what you actually get:

  • No pet fee ‚Äî not even for extended stays
  • No weight or breed restrictions ‚Äî Great Danes, pit bulls, whatever
  • Pet amenities included ‚Äî loaner beds, bowls, treats at check-in
  • Pet-friendly wine hour ‚Äî the nightly hosted reception welcomes dogs
  • Director of Pet Relations at some properties ‚Äî yes, it’s a dog

With 77+ locations in the US and a few international properties, you’ve got solid coverage in most major cities.

The catch? Kimpton is a boutique brand, so rates tend to run higher than your typical Hilton or Marriott. That’s where points come in.

How to Earn IHG Points for Kimpton

Kimpton is part of IHG (InterContinental Hotels Group), so you book using IHG One Rewards points. There are two main ways to stack up enough points for free stays:

  1. IHG credit cards (direct earning)
  2. Chase Ultimate Rewards (transfer partner)

Option 1: IHG Credit Cards

If you stay at IHG properties regularly, their co-branded Chase cards make sense.

üíé IHG One Rewards Premier Credit Card

The card for frequent IHG travelers.
Annual Fee $99
Sign-Up Bonus 140,000 points after $3,000 spend in 3 months
Free Night 1/year at properties up to 40,000 points
Status Platinum Elite

That 140,000-point bonus is enough for 2-4 free nights at most Kimptons, depending on the property and dates.

Key perks:

  • üí≥ 26x points at IHG properties
  • ‚úàÔ∏è 5x on travel, gas, and restaurants
  • üåô 4th night free on award stays (book 4, pay for 3)
  • üéÅ Annual free night certificate

üí° Pro tip: The 4th night free benefit is huge. If you’re booking a 4-night Kimpton stay with points, you’re effectively getting 25% off. A 200,000-point redemption becomes 150,000.

How the $99 fee pays for itself:

Perk Value

Total $200+

üÜì IHG One Rewards Traveler Credit Card

Free Night None

If you’re not sure how often you’ll stay at IHG properties, this is a safe way to start earning points. 80,000 points for $2,000 in spending with no annual fee is solid.

Key perks:

  • üí≥ 17x points at IHG properties
  • üçΩÔ∏è 3x on dining, gas, and groceries
  • üåô 4th night free on award stays (yes, even with the no-fee card)

Option 2: Chase Ultimate Rewards Transfer

If you want more flexibility, Chase Ultimate Rewards points transfer 1:1 to IHG. This is my preferred approach because I can use the same points for flights, other hotels, or cash back if I need to.

Cards that earn transferable Ultimate Rewards:

Chase Sapphire Preferred

Annual Fee $95
Sign-Up Bonus 60,000 points after $4,000 spend in 3 months
  • 3x on dining, select streaming, and online groceries
  • 2x on travel
  • Points transfer to 14+ airline and hotel partners including IHG

Chase Sapphire Reserve

Annual Fee $550
Sign-Up Bonus 60,000 points after $4,000 spend in 3 months
  • 3x on dining and travel
  • $300 annual travel credit (effectively reduces fee to $250)
  • Priority Pass lounge access
  • Points worth 1.5x when booked through Chase Travel

üí° Pro tip: If you already have a Sapphire card for travel, you don’t need an IHG card. Just transfer points when you find a Kimpton you want to book. Transfers are instant.

How Many Points Do Kimpton Stays Cost?

IHG uses dynamic pricing, so point costs vary by property, date, and demand. Here’s what I’ve seen:

Demand Points/Night Example
Off-peak 20,000‚Äì35,000 Midweek in shoulder season

Peak 70,000‚Äì100,000+ Holidays, special events

For reference, I searched Kimpton Hotel Monaco Denver for a random February weekend and found award nights around 45,000 points. Paid rates were $280/night, so that’s solid value.

Remember: If you have the IHG Premier card, book 4 nights and the 4th is free. That 180,000-point booking becomes 135,000.

Best Kimpton Properties for Dog Travelers

Not every Kimpton is equal when it comes to dog-friendliness (location matters). Here are some I’ve researched or have on my list:

üèîÔ∏è Kimpton Hotel Monaco Denver

Downtown location with easy access to trails. The wine hour is popular, and staff are known for going above and beyond for pets. Close to Cherry Creek Dog Park.

üå≥ Kimpton Brice Hotel (Savannah)

Enclosed courtyard that’s perfect for the evening wine reception with your pup. Walking distance to Forsyth Park ‚Äî one of the most dog-friendly parks in the South.

üå¥ Kimpton Rowan Palm Springs

Near several dog parks and surrounded by pet-friendly restaurant patios. Great for a desert getaway when it’s not 115¬∞F.

üèîÔ∏è Kimpton Arras (Asheville)

Gateway to Blue Ridge Mountains hiking. Asheville is extremely dog-friendly, with tons of outdoor dining and brewery patios that welcome dogs.

üç∫ Kimpton Journeyman (Milwaukee)

Dedicated pet-friendly floors. Good urban location for exploring with your dog.

Which Card Should You Get?

You… Get This Why

üíé Already have Hilton cards Chase Sapphire Preferred Add IHG as a transfer option

If you’re already in the Hilton ecosystem (like me), the Sapphire Preferred is a good complement. You keep your Hilton setup for most trips and transfer Chase points to IHG when you want to book a Kimpton.

The Bottom Line

Kimpton is the best hotel chain for dog travelers, full stop. No other major brand matches their policy ‚Äî no fees, no weight limits, no breed restrictions, and actual dog amenities beyond a sad bowl at the front desk.

The only downside is price. Kimpton properties aren’t cheap. But that’s exactly why points matter here. A $300/night boutique hotel stay feels very different when it costs you 45,000 points you earned from everyday spending.

If you’re traveling with a large dog and want a stress-free check-in experience, Kimpton should be on your radar. And now you know how to book it free.
